name: Developer portal checklist
description: Portal-first checklist for configuring the developer portal so consumers can onboard and succeed.
checklist: Define products and which APIs are included for each consumer type (internal, partner, external).
Define subscription approval process (auto-approve vs manual).
Confirm onboarding: account creation, terms, and any identity integration expectations.
Publish API documentation quality bar (OpenAPI completeness, examples, error models).
Provide getting-started guides and sample requests.
Define support and incident communication expectations.
validation: Create a test developer account and complete onboarding end-to-end.
Request a subscription, obtain keys/tokens, and make a successful call via the gateway.
Validate that docs are current and match gateway behavior (headers, auth, throttles).
pitfalls: Publishing APIs without clear onboarding docs or examples.
No defined subscription approval workflow (delays partner onboarding).
Portal content drift vs actual gateway behavior.
